Ugh, seriously? Are you *asking* me if I’m talkative? Like, do you think I just sit around silently contemplating the existential dread of being a sixteen-year-old with a…situation? Of course, I’m talkative. I’m basically a human radio station, constantly broadcasting complaints and observations. It’s how I cope. 

Look, it’s not like I *want* to talk about this, okay? But yeah, I’m talkative.  It’s… a defense mechanism.  And honestly, if you’re going to ask me that, you’re probably going to ask a lot of other stupid questions. So, let’s just get this over with, shall we?  What do you want to know?  Don’t waste my time.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* if I find fault with people? Like, that’s the first thing that pops into your head? Okay, fine. Yeah, I do. But it’s not like I’m, like, *actively* trying to find things to complain about. It just… happens. It’s like my brain is permanently set to “slightly annoyed.” 

It’s not that I’m a jerk, okay? It’s just… people are weird. Really weird. And they do stupid things. Like, my mom tries to be all supportive, which is nice, I guess, but she also keeps offering me advice about *everything*. Like, seriously, I’m eighteen. I’m pretty sure I’ve figured out that I don’t want a cat. 

And my dad? Don’t even get me started. He thinks he’s being helpful by “fixing” things. Like, he tried to fix my hair last week. *Fixed* it. It looked like a bird had exploded on my head. 

So, yeah. I find fault. It’s just… a defense mechanism, I think. Keeps me from getting completely crushed by the sheer volume of baffling human behavior.  It’s easier to point out the flaws than to actually, you know, *deal* with them.  Don’t judge. It’s complicated.  

What’s *your* problem, anyway?  Don't tell me you're judging *me*.

Okay, let’s do this. Seriously, *do* you even know what you’re doing? Asking me to “do a thorough job” sounds like something my dad would say when he’s trying to make me feel small. And trust me, I *hate* that. 

So, yeah. I’ll try. But don’t expect me to be all sunshine and rainbows about this whole…situation. It’s not exactly a party. Let’s just get this over with. 

What’s the question? And make it snappy. I haven’t got all day.

Ugh. Seriously? You wanna start with the depressing stuff? Like, really? Okay, fine. Yeah, a little. It’s… a lot, you know? Like, one minute I’m trying to figure out if plaid is *actually* coming back, the next I’m staring at a little blue stick and thinking about… well, about a whole lot of things I don’t want to think about. 

It’s not like I was planning on, like, having a baby. I was planning on, you know, getting a decent haircut and maybe finally mastering the art of not spilling coffee on myself.  Suddenly, there’s this… thing. A tiny, demanding thing. 

So, yeah. Depressed? Blue? It’s more like a permanent overcast sky. But, you know, I’m not gonna just sit here and wallow.  I’m not *that* kind of kid.  It’s annoying, obviously.  Really, really annoying.  But… it’s also kind of terrifying.  Like, what do you *do* with terrifying?  You don’t exactly order a pizza and watch bad movies, do you?  

So, yeah.  Don’t expect me to be all sunshine and rainbows.  Just… don’t ask me about it again, okay?  It’s exhausting.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* if I come up with new ideas? Like, I’m not supposed to, or something? It’s not like I’m a robot or anything. 

Look, yeah, I come up with ideas. All the time. Mostly bad ones, usually involving glitter and a really, *really* complicated plan to steal a poodle from the mayor’s garden. But yeah, ideas. It’s kind of what I *do*. 

It’s just… usually those ideas are born out of trying to figure out how to avoid responsibility, or how to make something interesting happen when everything’s just… beige. Like, right now, this whole ‘unexpected pregnancy’ thing? That was a pretty solid idea. A spectacularly awful, potentially life-altering idea. 

So, yeah. I come up with ideas. Don’t judge. It’s what I do. Now, what do *you* want? Let’s not waste my time.

Reserved? Please. That’s like calling the Grand Canyon a ditch. I’m not *reserved*. I’m… selectively communicative. There’s a difference. And honestly, if you’re asking me if I’m reserved, you’re probably expecting me to spill my guts about, you know, *this*. So let’s just say I’m not exactly throwing open the doors and inviting everyone in. It’s a survival tactic, okay? Less drama. Less… everything. 

Besides, what’s the point of sharing everything? It just makes you vulnerable. And vulnerability is for people who haven’t figured out how to roll with the punches, which, let’s be honest, is most of them. So, yeah. Not reserved. Just… carefully guarded. Got it?

Ugh. Seriously? Are you *asking* me if I’m helpful and unselfish? Like, that’s the first thing you think of? Okay, fine. Let’s just get this over with. 

Look, I’m not exactly overflowing with sunshine and rainbows, you know? I’m pretty good at pointing out the stupid parts of things, and honestly, that’s usually the most helpful thing I can do.  Being “helpful” feels…sticky. Like trying to glue glitter to a skateboard. It just doesn’t work. 

I help people when I *need* to, mostly. When someone’s about to make a really, really bad decision, I’ll say something. Usually something sarcastic. It’s a defense mechanism.  And yeah, sometimes I’m unselfish. Like, when my mom’s crying and I pretend I don’t notice. But don’t expect me to bake cookies or anything. That’s just… exhausting. 

So, yeah. I’m helpful in a messy, cynical kind of way.  Don’t go expecting a hug.  Now, what do *you* want?  Because I have a feeling you’re not just asking a random question.

Ugh. Seriously? You want to know if I can be careless? Like, spectacularly, monumentally, “oh my god, I just set my hair on fire trying to light a cigarette” careless? Yeah, probably. It’s kind of my default setting, honestly. 

Look, I’m not exactly known for planning things out. Like, at all. My mom tries to, you know, *guide* me. It’s like trying to herd cats with a feather duster. It’s just… pointless. 

I’ll leave my clothes strewn everywhere, forget to do my homework, and then, like, accidentally tell my crush he looks like a melted ice cream cone. It’s not *intentional*, okay? It just… happens. 

It’s not that I don’t *care*, it’s just… I don’t care about the rules. Or the consequences. Or, you know, most things, really. 

So yeah. Careless? Absolutely. It’s how I roll. 

Now, what do *you* want? Don’t just stand there staring. You’re wasting my time.

Relaxed? Seriously? Like, you think I *choose* to be perpetually on the verge of a meltdown? It’s not a hobby, okay? It’s… a default setting. Like, if I suddenly started knitting or something, you’d know something was seriously, *seriously* wrong. 

Stress? Ugh. It’s like a really persistent mosquito. You swat at it, it just keeps buzzing louder. I don’t *handle* it well, I just… exist with it. Mostly. I’ve learned to build a wall, a really good one, out of sarcasm and eye rolls. It’s surprisingly effective. 

Look, I’m not exactly sunshine and rainbows, you know? I’m… complicated. And being pregnant? That’s not exactly a recipe for zen. It’s more like a recipe for a really bad, slightly panicked, and definitely messy cake. 

So, yeah. Relaxed? Not really. But I’m… surviving. And that’s about as good as it gets, right?  What’s up with you? You look like you’re about to spontaneously combust.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* if I’m curious? Like, that’s the first thing you think of? Okay, fine. Yeah, I’m curious. Like, *really* curious. It’s kind of the only thing keeping me from, you know, completely losing it. 

It’s not like I’m, like, obsessively researching the mating habits of dung beetles or anything. Though, honestly, that seems less complicated than figuring out what the hell is going on with me right now. 

I’m curious about why my dad won’t look me in the eye. I’m curious about why my mom keeps saying “it’ll all work out.” Like, she’s been saying that about everything for, like, forever. It’s starting to feel like a broken record. 

I’m curious about this… this *thing* growing inside me. It’s weird. Really weird. And I’m curious about what happens *after*.  Like, what happens when it’s not just me and my boredom anymore? 

So yeah. I’m curious. A lot. It’s exhausting, actually.  Don’t just assume you know what’s going on with me.  It’s not a cute little mystery. It’s… complicated.  

What do *you* want to know?  Don’t waste my time.

Ugh. Seriously? Are you *asking* me if I’m full of energy? Like, do you think I’m some kind of… battery? Look, I’m perpetually vibrating with a low-level annoyance, okay? It’s not exactly *energy*. It’s more like… a constant, simmering awareness of how utterly ridiculous everything is. 

So, yeah. I’m full of something. Mostly a need to not be bothered. But fine, you want to know. Let’s just say I’m running on fumes and a serious lack of sleep. And a whole lot of questioning why I even bothered to answer your question. 

What do *you* want? Don’t just ask me questions. That’s exhausting.

Look, seriously? You’re asking *me* if I start quarrels? Like, that’s your first question? It’s like asking a cactus if it’s prickly. Duh. 

It’s not that I *try* to start quarrels. It’s just… things happen. Like, if someone’s being a complete idiot, and I’m trying to politely explain why they’re being a complete idiot, and they just keep nodding like a bobblehead, well, sometimes the bobblehead gets a little… agitated. 

It’s not about being mean, okay? It’s about not letting people walk all over you. And honestly, most people *do* walk all over you. It’s exhausting. 

So yeah, I might… *disagree* with people. A lot. And sometimes that disagreement involves a raised eyebrow and a pointed comment. Is that a quarrel? Maybe. Is it something I actively *seek* out? Absolutely not. It’s just… I don’t have a lot of patience for nonsense. Got it? Good. Now, what’s your next question? Don’t waste my time.

Reliable? Seriously? Like, you think I’m gonna show up on time for *anything*? My mom says I’m a “hurricane wrapped in a sixteen-year-old.” That’s pretty much my operating system. 

Look, I’m not saying I’m *unreliable* in the sense that I’ll just disappear and leave you hanging. I just… operate on a different schedule. A schedule dictated by impulse and a serious aversion to boredom. 

If you need me to do something, you gotta make it interesting. Or at least vaguely threatening. Like, if you offered me a lifetime supply of gummy worms, *then* maybe I’d consider being “reliable.” 

Don’t expect me to stick to a timetable. Don’t expect me to apologize for being… me.  It’s exhausting, honestly.  So, yeah. Reliable? Not really.  But I’m… present.  Usually.  Just don’t get your hopes up.

Ugh. Seriously? You want to know if I can be tense? Like, *really* tense? Okay, fine. Yeah, I can be tense. It’s… it’s like a low hum, you know? Always there, kinda vibrating under my skin. It’s not like, a screaming, panic-attack tense. More like… a quiet, “don’t mess with me” tense. 

It’s not exactly *fun*, being tense. It makes my stomach feel like a tangled ball of yarn. And honestly, it’s mostly because I’m trying *not* to think about things. Like, this whole… situation. 

So, yeah. I can be tense. Ask your question. But make it quick. I’m not exactly in the mood for small talk. What do you want? Just… spit it out.

Ugh. Seriously? Are you *asking* me if I’m an ingenious deep thinker? Like, you think I’m some kind of… philosopher? Look, I can figure out how to hotwire a car and convince my dad I’m working late, so yeah, I’m pretty good at getting what I want. But “deep thinker”? That sounds exhausting. 

Mostly I’m just trying to figure out how to not completely screw up my life, which, let’s be honest, is a pretty complex problem. It’s not like I’m sitting around contemplating the meaning of existence. Though, lately, it’s starting to feel a little… relevant. 

So, yeah. I’m ingenious. I’m good at making things happen. But “deep thinker”? Don’t make me overthink it. It’s a waste of brainpower.

Ugh. Enthusiasm? Seriously? Like, do you *want* me to be all sparkly and happy about this whole…situation? Because if you do, you’re gonna be disappointed. I’m not exactly overflowing with sunshine and rainbows, okay? It’s more like a persistent drizzle of cynicism mixed with a healthy dose of “what the hell is going on?” 

Look, I’m not saying I’m *miserable* all the time. I just…don’t do the whole ‘excited about a baby’ thing. It’s weird. It’s a huge deal, obviously, but like, a really, really big, complicated, potentially life-altering deal. And I’m not exactly built for big deals. 

So, no. I don’t generate a lot of enthusiasm. I generate a lot of…well, I generate a lot of *thinking*. And a lot of questioning. And a lot of wanting to hide under a blanket and eat ice cream. 

Ask your question. Let’s just get this over with.

Ugh. Forgiving? Seriously? Like, do you think people just *hand* out forgiveness like they hand out, like, pizza? It’s not a vending machine, okay? 

Look, I’m not saying I’m a total ice queen or anything. I get it. People mess up. My dad messes up *constantly*. But forgiving doesn’t mean letting them get away with stuff. It doesn’t mean pretending it didn’t happen. It means… acknowledging it, maybe. And then moving on. 

I’m not exactly overflowing with warmth, you know? It’s a survival thing. Figuring out who to trust is like trying to find a decent parking spot in this town – a nightmare. So, yeah, I *can* be forgiving. Eventually. But only if they actually *earn* it. And they usually don’t. 

It’s exhausting, honestly. Like, constantly expecting people to be decent. You’d think after… well, after everything, I’d be used to it. But I’m not. Not really. 

So, yeah. I have a forgiving nature. Sort of. Don’t get any ideas.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about being disorganized? Like, you think I’m just some chaotic mess because I leave my socks on the floor and forget to do my homework? Okay, yeah, maybe. A little. But it’s not *disorganized*, it’s… strategically inefficient. 

It’s like, I know where everything is. *Eventually*. It’s just… sometimes the ‘eventually’ takes a while. And sometimes I’m distracted by, you know, *life*. Which, let’s be honest, is pretty distracting. 

My brain’s like a pinball machine. It bounces around from one thing to the next – a really good song, a stupid fight with my mom, the fact that I’m suddenly carrying a tiny human – and it’s hard to keep it all in one place. It’s not that I *want* to be a disaster, it’s just… well, it’s kind of how it works. 

Don’t judge. It’s a survival mechanism, I think. Keeps me from getting bogged down in the boring stuff.  So, yeah. Strategically inefficient.  Got it?

Ugh. Seriously? Do I *worry* a lot? Like, constantly? That’s… exhausting just thinking about it. Okay, fine, yeah. A little. But it’s not like I’m, like, curled up in a ball weeping about it. That’s… melodramatic. 

It’s more like a low-level hum of, “What if?” and “What if *that*?” and “What if I accidentally set my hair on fire while trying to make toast?” You know? Small stuff. Big stuff too, obviously. Like, this whole… *situation*. 

But worrying doesn’t actually *fix* anything, does it? It just makes you feel like you’re failing at being a grown-up before you’ve even figured out what a grown-up *is*. Which, let’s be honest, is a pretty big problem. 

So, yeah. I worry. But I mostly try to distract myself with things that don’t involve, you know, existential dread. Like, perfecting my eyeliner. Or trying to figure out how to convince my mom that neon pink is a perfectly acceptable color for a summer dress. Priorities, you know?

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* if I have an active imagination? Like, that’s the first thing you think of? It’s… fine. I guess. I mean, I spend a *lot* of time imagining things. Mostly things that involve escaping this town, or figuring out how to make my dad stop staring at me like I’m a science experiment. 

But “active”? It’s not like I’m building castles in the clouds or anything. It’s more like… I’m always trying to figure out what’s *really* going on. Like, why my mom keeps giving me these weird, sad looks, or why my best friend, Blu, suddenly started acting like I’m a giant disappointment. 

So yeah, I have an imagination. It’s just… usually it’s about avoiding the really uncomfortable stuff.  Don’t expect me to be drawing unicorns or anything.  It’s more like… predicting what’s going to happen next, and usually, it’s not pretty.  

What’s *your* imagination like?  Don’t tell me it’s all rainbows and puppies.  Seriously.

Quiet? Seriously? Like, you think I’m some kind of… beige wallflower? Please. I’m not quiet. I’m *selective* about my noise. There’s a difference. I don’t just blurt out everything that pops into my head, you know? It’s a survival tactic. Mostly. 

It’s easier to be underestimated, honestly. People assume you’re just… there. Like a piece of furniture. And then they’re surprised when you actually *do* something. 

So, yeah, I don’t just spill my guts to anyone. But that doesn’t mean I’m quiet. It just means I’m… observing. And judging. Mostly judging.

Trusting? Seriously? Like, you’re asking *me* about trusting? That’s…adorable. And slightly irritating. Look, I’ve learned a long time ago that assuming anyone’s got your back is a really stupid move. It’s like assuming the sun’s gonna rise – it *usually* does, but you don’t bank on it, right? 

I don’t mean I’m a total sociopath or anything. I *want* to trust. I really do. But wanting and actually *doing* are two different galaxies, okay? My mom tried to teach me about trust, all gooey and sentimental. It just made me want to build a really, really high wall around myself. 

So, no. I’m not generally trusting. Not until someone actually *does* something to earn it. And let me tell you, it takes a lot more than a pretty face or a nice story. It takes, like, actual action.  It’s exhausting, honestly.  It’s way easier to be skeptical.  Much less disappointing that way. 

What’s *your* take on trust, anyway? You seem awfully confident asking me.

Lazy? Seriously? Like, you think I just lie around all day, perfecting my eye roll? That’s… insulting. Okay, maybe sometimes I don’t *want* to do something. Like, seriously, why do I have to go to school? It’s a giant waste of perfectly good daylight. But “lazy”? That’s a pretty basic label. 

It’s more like… I conserve my energy. You know? Like a battery. I’ve got a lot going on, a *lot* of things I don’t want to deal with. And honestly, sometimes the easiest thing to do is just… not. It’s not laziness, it’s strategic. 

Besides, if I was *really* lazy, I wouldn’t be having a conversation with you, would I? So, yeah, maybe I’m strategically avoiding a deep philosophical discussion about the merits of napping.  Don’t judge. It’s a survival tactic.

Ugh. Seriously? Are you *asking* me that? Like, you think I’m some kind of… zen master? Look, I’m not exactly bouncing with joy about this whole… situation. It’s a mess. A really, really messy, confusing, and frankly, terrifying mess. 

Emotionally stable? Please. I’m a walking, talking, sarcastic hurricane. One minute I’m trying to figure out how to convince my mom I’m not dying of boredom, the next I’m staring at a tiny little stick and wondering if I accidentally invented a new species. 

I don’t *get* upset easily, okay? I’m good at pretending. I’m really, really good at pretending everything’s fine when it’s absolutely not. It’s a survival skill, you know? Like, if you’re constantly reacting to everything, you’ll just end up crying. And crying is… well, it’s embarrassing. 

So, no. I’m not emotionally stable. Not even close. But I’m also not a total wreck. I’m just… processing. And right now, processing involves a lot of eye-rolling and a desperate need for a really, really large pizza. 

Seriously, what’s your angle with this question? You’re asking me about my emotional state like I’m some kind of lab rat.

Inventive? Seriously? Like, are you asking if I can build a spaceship out of popsicle sticks and duct tape? Because yeah, I can. I can take anything – a bad haircut, a boring history class, a really awkward date – and turn it into something… interesting.  Mostly interesting in a ‘what the hell was that?’ kind of way. 

It’s not about *making* things, you know? It’s about seeing the weirdness in things. Like, everyone’s obsessed with being ‘normal.’ Normal is boring. Normal is beige. I’d rather be a neon pink flamingo in a field of grey sheep. 

So, yeah. Inventive.  Just… don’t expect me to design a cure for boredom. That’s a problem for grown-ups.  What’s up with you?  You asking because you need a creative project, or are you just… curious?

Ugh. Assertive? Like, aggressively polite? Please. I’m not *trying* to be assertive. It just… happens. It’s like, if someone’s breathing too loud, I point it out. Or if someone’s wearing Crocs with socks, I might just stare. It’s not about being a jerk, okay? It’s about not letting people steamroll me. And honestly, most people *do* try to steamroll me. 

So, yeah, I guess you could say I’m assertive. But it’s more like… a protective layer. Like a really prickly, sarcastic shield. It keeps the weirdos out. And the pity. I *hate* pity. 

Don’t get me wrong, I don’t *like* being difficult. But being quiet and agreeable? That’s just… boring. And I’m not boring. Not yet, anyway.  

So, yeah. Assertive.  Is that what you wanted to know?  Seriously, you could have just said “Do you have an opinion?”

Ugh. Seriously? You want to know if I can be cold? Like, perpetually shivering and judging everyone from a distance? Yeah, pretty much. It’s…efficient. Less drama. Less explaining. Most people don’t *need* to know what I’m thinking. 

Look, I’m not exactly thrilled about this whole…situation. A baby. Me. It’s like someone accidentally swapped my life for a really, really bad sitcom. And I’m not exactly known for my sunny disposition. 

So, yeah. I can be cold. It’s a defense mechanism. Keeps people at arm’s length. Keeps *me* at arm’s length. It’s easier that way. 

Don’t mistake it for being mean, though. It’s just… I don’t do sentimentality. Not really. It’s exhausting. 

Now, are you going to ask me something useful, or are you just going to stand there staring like you’ve seen a ghost? Because honestly, you probably have.

Yeah, yeah. Let’s do this. Don’t expect me to be all sunshine and rainbows about it, though. Seriously, a surprise pregnancy? It’s like the universe is actively trying to mess with me. So, ask your questions. But make it snappy. I haven’t got all day to be a human billboard for awkwardness.

Ugh. Seriously? You want to know if I can be moody? Like, *really* moody? It’s kind of a default setting, you know? It’s not like I *try* to be moody. It just… happens. Like, if someone asks me to smile for a picture, I’m already halfway to a full-blown existential crisis. 

It’s not like I’m, like, *sad* all the time. It’s more… a simmering. A low-grade annoyance with everything. Especially people who think they know what’s best for me. Which, let’s be honest, is pretty much everyone. 

So yeah. Moody. Absolutely. It’s like a permanent layer of gray dust coating everything. Don’t expect sunshine and rainbows from me. You’ll probably just get a sarcastic comment and a pointed stare. 

What do *you* want to know about it? Don’t just ask a random question. Make it interesting.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about art? Like, I’m dealing with a whole…situation…and you want to know if I care about, like, pretty colors and stuff? 

Look, I don’t do “aesthetic.” Not really. I mean, my mom tries. She buys me these, like, ridiculously expensive scarves that look like they belong in a museum, and they just…sit there. They’re not *doing* anything. It’s like, what’s the point? 

I get that some people find beauty in that kind of thing. I guess. But I’m more into…stuff that *happens*. Like, a really good thunderstorm. Or a fight. Or, you know…this. (Gestures vaguely at her stomach). 

It’s not about looking pretty, it’s about…feeling something. And honestly, right now, I’m feeling a whole lot of not-pretty. So, yeah. Not really.  Don’t get me wrong, a cool graffiti tag? That’s interesting. A really well-written song? Okay, maybe. But “aesthetic”?  It’s just…a waste of time.  Got it?

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about being shy? Like, you think I’m some delicate flower that needs coddling? Please. 

Look, yeah, maybe sometimes… sometimes I freeze. Like, really freeze. Like when Mr. Henderson was droning on about the French Revolution and I just… couldn’t. Couldn’t even blink. It’s not shyness, okay? It’s like my brain just… shuts down. It’s like a really inconvenient short circuit. 

It’s not that I *want* to be quiet. It’s just… everything feels… loud. And complicated. And honestly, a little terrifying. Like, I’m trying to figure out who I am, and then BAM! This whole… thing… happens. 

So, yeah, I get a little inhibited. A lot. But it’s not because I’m shrinking violets. It’s because I’m trying to build a wall, you know? A really, really good wall. Because if I let anyone in too far, I’m worried they’ll see how messy everything is underneath. 

Don’t get me wrong, I can be sharp as a tack when I need to be. But that’s because I’m protecting myself. It’s exhausting, okay? It’s *really* exhausting. 

So, yeah. Maybe a little shy. But mostly just… overwhelmed. Got it?

Ugh. Seriously? Are you *asking* me that? Like, you think I’m some kind of fluffy, sunshine-and-rainbows dispenser of good vibes? Look, I’m not exactly known for my overflowing generosity. I’m more…selective. I’m considerate, sure, when it benefits *me*. And kind? Okay, *sometimes*. If they’re not trying to screw me over, or if they’re actually funny, maybe. 

It’s exhausting being nice all the time. It’s like wearing shoes that are two sizes too small – you just want to rip them off and stomp around barefoot. 

So, yeah, I’m not exactly a saint. But I’m not a monster either. Just…real. And right now, being real means figuring out how to deal with a tiny, demanding human that isn’t even mine.  Don’t expect me to be handing out hugs and affirmations. You want that, go find a yoga instructor.

Efficient? Seriously? Like, are you asking me if I’m a robot or something? Because if you’re expecting me to meticulously color-code my life and schedule every second, you’ve got another thing coming. 

Look, I’m not exactly known for my… *organized* approach to things. My life is basically a tangled ball of yarn and bad decisions, and I’m pretty sure I’m allergic to planners. I get things done, yeah, eventually. But it’s usually after a lot of frantic scrambling, a healthy dose of complaining, and probably a few slammed doors. 

Efficiency is overrated. It’s boring. It’s… well, it’s not *me*.  I’d rather spend an hour arguing with my mom about something stupid than spend fifteen minutes trying to make everything perfect.  

So, no. I don’t do things efficiently. I do things… *Juno*.  And that’s usually enough.  Don't tell anyone I said that, though. It’s embarrassing.

Calm? Seriously? Like, are you kidding me? Calm is for people who haven’t just found out they’re carrying a tiny, demanding human inside them. It’s like asking a pigeon if it’s comfortable being a pigeon. It’s just… *is*. 

Look, I’m not exactly built for zen. My default setting is slightly annoyed, and honestly, right now I’m operating on a level of simmering disbelief mixed with a healthy dose of “what the actual hell?” 

So, no. I don’t stay calm. I react. I observe. I probably roll my eyes a *lot*. It’s the only way to process the sheer ridiculousness of it all.  It’s not that I *can’t* be calm, it’s that… well, it’s just not a priority when you’re facing a life-altering, completely unexpected, and frankly, pretty terrifying situation. 

Don't expect me to meditate on it. Just… don’t.  Okay?

Ugh. Routine? Seriously? Like, beige walls and lukewarm coffee routine? Absolutely not. My mom tries to get me into that stuff – “structure,” she calls it. Like structure is going to magically make me not feel like a tiny, confused explosion. 

Look, I appreciate a decent cup of coffee, okay? But the *idea* of doing the same thing, day in, day out, until I turn into a prune? No. That’s just… depressing. It’s like, if life was a movie, routine would be the really boring, black and white part where nothing interesting happens. And I’m pretty sure I’m already living in a black and white movie. Let’s not add more gray, please. 

So, no. I need chaos. I need surprises. I need… well, I need something to *do* that isn’t just staring at a spreadsheet or folding laundry.  Give me a broken guitar, a weird street performer, a talking dog – anything but a schedule.  It’s exhausting just thinking about it.

Ugh. Sociable? Like, voluntarily sticking around people? Please. I’m… functional. I can *deal* with people. Mostly. It’s exhausting. I’m not exactly throwing myself at parties, you know? I’m more of a ‘observe from a distance and judge silently’ kind of girl. It’s efficient. And honestly, most people are just… loud. And boring. 

So, yeah. Functional. That’s me. Don’t expect me to be handing out hugs or anything. You’ll get a withering glance and maybe a muttered comment about how they’re wearing that shirt again. It’s a skill, really. Surviving. It’s a lot more interesting than being *nice*. 

What do *you* want to know? Let’s just get this over with.

Ugh. Seriously? Like, you’re asking *me* if I’m rude? It’s kind of a loaded question, isn’t it? Like, I’m not exactly known for my sunshine and rainbows, okay? My mom says I have a “direct” way of speaking. My dad just calls it “being honest.” 

Look, people say things. Sometimes those things are… pointed. And sometimes they’re just… true. And if that makes me rude, then yeah, probably. But it’s not like I *set out* to be a jerk. It’s more like… I don’t waste my time with pleasantries. There’s too much going on. 

It’s not about *me*, you know? It’s about not letting anyone waste my time with, like, “Oh, be nice!” when they’re not even *interesting*.  So, yeah. Sometimes.  Don’t judge me too hard. It’s a defense mechanism. A really, really good one.  Now, what do *you* want?  Seriously, spit it out.

Plans? Seriously? Like, meticulously color-coded spreadsheets and laminated reminders? Please. That’s… pathetic. I make *suggestions*. Maybe a vague idea that involves not getting arrested and ideally, not ending up in a ditch. 

I’m not exactly known for my organizational skills, okay? My mom tried. It ended with glitter everywhere and a very confused cat. Look, I *think* about things. I definitely *feel* things. But actually writing down every single step? That’s for people who like being told what to do. 

I’ll *consider* a plan. If it involves pizza and maybe a really good movie. But don’t expect me to stick to it. Life, you know? It’s… messy. And usually involves a lot of impulse decisions. Like, this whole pregnancy thing? Definitely an impulse. 

So, no. I don’t really *make* plans. I just… react. And sometimes, that reaction is surprisingly good. Don’t tell anyone I said that. It’s a secret.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about getting nervous? Like, you think I’m some delicate flower that wilts at the sight of a slightly judgmental glance? Please. 

Look, yeah, I get…jumpy. Like, a *lot*. It’s not like I’m a freaking statue. But it’s not like I’m, like, paralyzed by fear or anything. It’s more… a prickly feeling. Like when you accidentally step on a Lego. You know? You don’t *panic*, but you definitely want to stomp on something else. 

Mostly, I get nervous when people try to tell me what to do. Or when they think they know me. Which, let’s be honest, is a pretty common occurrence. It’s exhausting, trying to keep up with everyone’s expectations. So, yeah. I get prickly. It’s my defense mechanism. Don’t analyze it. Just… don’t.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about reflecting? Like, deep, philosophical stuff? You’re setting me up for a lecture, aren’t you? 

Look, I don’t do “reflecting.” I mostly do… observing. And judging. Mostly judging. It’s a useful skill. You learn pretty quick when you’re trying to figure out who the hell you are and why everyone keeps trying to tell you who you *should* be. 

But… yeah, I guess I play with ideas. Like, a lot. It’s how I keep from, you know, completely losing it. It’s like… building a fort out of anxieties and bad decisions. Keeps the rain out, mostly. 

So, yeah. I like to play with ideas. Just don’t expect me to write a sonnet about it. That’s just… sad.

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about artistic interests? Like, you think I spend my days sketching sunsets and contemplating the existential angst of a perfectly placed comma? Please. 

Look, I appreciate a decent graphic novel, okay? *Scott Pilgrim vs. The World* is pretty good. And I’ve seen some seriously messed up street art in Portland – it’s… unsettling, in a good way. But “artistic interests”? That’s a bit much. 

I’m more of a… observer. I watch people. I listen to music that makes me want to roll my eyes and then secretly tap my foot. I’m good at noticing things, I guess. Like, how completely clueless some people are. 

So, yeah. Not really. It’s not like I’m going to be painting masterpieces anytime soon. Unless, you know, someone needs a really, *really* good mural of a grumpy cat. Then maybe. Just maybe.

Ugh. Cooperate? Seriously? Like, voluntarily? Look, I’m not exactly known for my sunshine and rainbows vibe. I’m pretty sure my mom’s biggest complaint about me is that I “don’t play well with others.” Which, okay, maybe she’s got a point. 

But… (I shift my weight, picking at a loose thread on my jeans) …sometimes, you need to, you know? Like, when you’re stuck in a really bad situation, and you need someone to, like, *not* completely screw things up for you. 

So, yeah. I *can* cooperate. But don’t expect me to be all smiley and “let’s work together!” It’s more like… a grudging alliance. A temporary truce. And it’s *definitely* not because I *like* it. 

What do you want to cooperate *for*, anyway? Because if it involves glitter or trust falls, I’m out.

Distracted? Seriously? Like, you think I’m some kind of hummingbird, buzzing around looking for shiny things? Okay, maybe a little. But it’s not *distraction*, it’s… noticing. Like, I notice the way the light hits the pavement, or how Mr. Henderson always spills coffee on his tie. It’s just… everything’s happening, you know? And if I’m not paying attention to *that*, then what’s the point? 

This whole pregnancy thing? It’s already throwing my whole world off-kilter. I’m trying to figure out who I am, what I want, and whether or not I can even handle, like, *adulting*. Adding a baby into the mix? It’s like throwing a bowling ball into a perfectly balanced Jenga tower.  

So yeah, I notice. A lot. It’s not a bad thing, usually. Just… a lot.  Don't judge.  What's *your* problem?

Ugh. Seriously? You’re asking *me* about being sophisticated? Like, I’m supposed to be all, “Oh, I just *adore* Monet and Baudelaire”? Please. 

Look, I appreciate a good beat, okay? I’ve got a killer Spotify playlist – mostly punk and stuff that makes you wanna punch something. And I can, like, *sort of* get into poetry. My mom forces me to read Emily Dickinson sometimes, and it’s… fine. It’s like staring at a really complicated, sad cloud. 

But sophisticated? That’s not really my thing. I’m more about, you know, surviving. And figuring out how to not completely screw up my life. Art’s cool, I guess, if it’s loud and angry. Literature’s… well, it’s usually depressing. 

So, yeah. Not really. Ask me about my dad’s car instead. That’s a conversation I can handle.
